verses.text: 掃羅家和大衛家之間的戰爭相持很久。大衛家逐漸興盛，掃羅家卻日趨衰微。

words.note: Refers to the lineage/dynasty of Saul.
Refers to the lineage/dynasty of David.

verses.text: 大衛在希伯崙生了幾個兒子：他的長子暗嫩，是耶斯列人亞希暖所生的。

words.note: 耶斯列 (Jezreel) is a place name.

verses.text: 次子基利押，是作過迦密人拿八的妻子亞比該所生的。三子押沙龍，是基述王達買的女兒瑪迦所生的。

words.note: 迦密 (Carmel) is a place name.
基述 (Geshur) is a place name, 王 (wáng) means king.

verses.text: 四子亞多尼雅，是哈及所生的。五子示法提雅，是亞比他所生的。
六子以特念，是大衛妻子以格拉所生的。這些兒子都是大衛在希伯崙所生的。
當掃羅家和大衛家交戰的時候，押尼珥在掃羅家的權勢日漸強大。
verses.heading: Abner Defects to David’s Camp

verses.text: 掃羅有一個妃子，名叫利斯巴，是愛亞的女兒。伊施波設對押尼珥說：「你為甚麼親近我父親的妃子呢？」

words.note: Refers to a royal concubine.

words.definition: to be intimate with, close to

words.note: Refers to a royal concubine.

verses.text: 押尼珥因伊施波設的話非常忿怒，說：「我是猶大的狗頭嗎？今天我厚待你的父親掃羅家、他的兄弟和他的朋友，沒有把你交在大衛的手中；可是，今天你竟為了這女人的事來找我的錯！

words.note: A strong insult, implying worthlessness or subservience.

verses.text: 我若不按著耶和華向大衛所起誓應許的去行：廢去掃羅家的王國，建立大衛的王位，使他統治以色列和猶大，從但直到別是巴，願 神降罰押尼珥，重重地降罰他。」

words.note: Indicates the object/result of the verb following it.

verses.text: 伊施波設因為懼怕押尼珥，就連一句話也不敢回答他。
押尼珥差派使者代表他去見大衛，說：「這地是屬誰的呢？」又說：「你與我立約，我就必幫助你，使全以色列都歸順你。」

words.note: Classical Chinese for '跟' (gēn)
Lit. 'return to obey'

verses.text: 大衛說：「好！我與你立約。不過，我要求你一件事：你來見我面的時候，首先要把掃羅的女兒米甲帶來，否則你必不得見我的面。」

words.note: Classical Chinese for '跟' (gēn)
Lit. 'not exceed'

verses.text: 後來，大衛差派使者去見掃羅的兒子伊施波設，說：「請你把我的妻子米甲還給我，她是我從前用一百個非利士人的包皮聘下的。」

words.note: Biblical context refers to circumcision

verses.text: 於是伊施波設派人去，把米甲從拉億的兒子她丈夫帕鐵那裡接回來。
米甲的丈夫與她一起去，跟在她後面，一邊走、一邊哭，一直跟到巴戶琳。押尼珥對他說：「你去吧！回去吧！」他只好回去了。

words.note: Classical Chinese for '跟' (gēn)

verses.text: 押尼珥與以色列的長老商議說：「從前你們希望大衛作你們的王。

words.note: Refers to respected leaders in a community.

verses.text: 現在可以實現了！因為耶和華曾經論到大衛說：『我要藉著我的僕人大衛的手，把我的子民以色列從非利士人和他們所有敵人的手中拯救出來。』」

words.note: Indicates the topic of discussion.
Often used in religious or historical contexts for a chosen people.
Often implies 'within one's control' or 'from one's grasp'.
Directional complement indicating movement out or emergence.

verses.text: 押尼珥也把這話說給便雅憫人聽，然後又去希伯崙，把以色列人和便雅憫全都同意的一切事說給大衛聽。
押尼珥帶著二十個人，來到希伯崙見大衛的時候，大衛就為押尼珥和與他同來的人擺設筵席。

words.note: A formal meal, often celebratory.

verses.text: 後來，押尼珥對大衛說：「讓我去把以色列眾人召集到我主我王這裡來，好叫他們與你立約，這樣你就可以照著自己的心願統治所有的人。」於是大衛打發押尼珥回去，他就平平安安地走了。

words.note: A reduplicated idiom emphasizing peace and safety.

verses.text: 那時，大衛的臣僕和約押攻擊敵人回來，帶回許多的戰利品。當時，押尼珥不在希伯崙大衛那裡，因為大衛已經打發他離去，他也平平安安地走了。

words.note: Refers to official servants or subordinates.
Items gained from a battle or war.
A reduplicated idiom emphasizing peace and safety.
Follows an adjective/adverb to form an adverbial phrase.
Indicates completion or a new situation.

verses.heading: Abner Is Killed

verses.text: 約押和跟隨他的全軍一到達，就有人告訴約押，尼珥的兒子押尼珥曾經來見過王。王打發他離去，他已經平平安安地走了。

words.note: Used with '就' (jiù) to mean 'as soon as...then'.
Indicates a consequence or immediate result.
Indicates something happened at least once in the past.
The particle '過' indicates a past experience.
A reduplicated idiom emphasizing peace and safety.
Follows an adjective/adverb to form an adverbial phrase.
Indicates completion or a new situation.

verses.text: 約押進去見王，說：「你作了甚麼事？尼珥的兒子押尼珥來見你，你為甚麼把他送走？現在他已經平平安安地走了。

words.note: Indicates completion or a new situation.
Indicates the object is being 'disposed' of or acted upon.
A reduplicated idiom emphasizing peace and safety.
Follows an adjective/adverb to form an adverbial phrase.
Indicates completion or a new situation.

verses.text: 你認識尼珥的兒子押尼珥，他來是要欺騙你，是要了解你的起居行動和你所作的一切事。」

words.note: Indicates intention or future action.
Indicates intention or future action.
Refers to one's movements and daily routine.
Used before a verb to form a nominal clause or phrase.
Forms a modifying phrase or nominalizes a verb phrase.

verses.text: 約押從大衛那裡出來，就差派使者去追趕押尼珥，使者從西拉的水井那裡把他帶回來。可是，大衛一點都不知道。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate action.
Indicates the object is being 'disposed' of or acted upon.
Often used with '都 (dōu) + 不 (bù)' to mean 'not at all'.
Used before a negative to mean 'not at all'.

verses.text: 押尼珥回到了希伯崙，約押就拉他到城門的甕洞裡與他密談。約押就在那裡刺透他的肚子，他就死了。這樣，他替自己的兄弟亞撒黑報了血仇。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
Lit. 'jar-hole', referring to a hidden or secluded spot.
More formal than '和' in some contexts.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Specific to contexts of revenge and feuds.

verses.text: 事後大衛聽到了，就說：「關於尼珥的兒子押尼珥的血案，我和我的國家，在耶和華面前永遠是無辜的。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
Refers to a criminal case involving bloodshed.
Often used as a postposition with '在'.
Turns a preceding adjective into a noun phrase or emphasizes an attribute.

verses.text: 願這流人血的罪歸到約押的頭上和他父親的全家！又願約押家不斷有患血漏病的、長痲風的、拿拐杖的、倒斃在劍下的和缺乏糧食的。」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for 'sin'.
Often used idiomatically for 'upon someone's head' (responsibility/consequence).
Refers to the entire family or lineage of Joab.
Refers to a chronic discharge of blood, a specific biblical ailment.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or adjective phrase, e.g., 'those who have...'
Here means to 'develop' or 'suffer from' a skin disease.
The traditional term for leprosy in biblical contexts.
Formal term for dying by falling, often used in older texts or specific contexts like battle.
Figurative phrase meaning to die by the sword.

verses.text: 因押尼珥在基遍的戰場上，殺死了他們的兄弟亞撒黑，約押和他的兄弟亞比篩就殺了押尼珥。

words.note: Often used to introduce a reason.
Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on' or 'at'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 大衛對約押和與他在一起的眾人說：「你們要撕裂衣服，腰束麻布，在押尼珥面前哀哭！」大衛王也走在棺木後面。

words.note: More formal than '和' in some contexts.
Here functions as a modal verb indicating command or strong advice.
Rending clothes was a traditional sign of grief or despair.
Refers to binding the waist with cloth, a common biblical practice for mourning.
Rough cloth worn as a sign of mourning or repentance in biblical times.
Often used as a postposition with '在'.
Often implies public and ritualized weeping, common in mourning.
King David is a compound name/title.
Formal term for a coffin, often used in written or solemn contexts.
Used as a locative postposition with '在'.

verses.text: 他們把押尼珥埋葬在希伯崙。王在押尼珥的墓旁放聲大哭，眾人也都哭了。
王又為押尼珥作了哀歌，說：「難道押尼珥死去，要像愚妄的人死去一樣嗎？

words.note: Used to express a rhetorical question.
Often used with 像 (xiàng) to mean 'like...the same'.

verses.text: 你的手沒有被繩索綁住，你的腳也沒有被銅鍊鎖住，你倒斃，好像人在暴徒面前倒斃一樣！」於是，眾民又為押尼珥哀哭。

words.note: Often used with 好像 (hǎoxiàng) to mean 'like...the same'.

verses.text: 還在白天的時候，眾人都來勸大衛吃點飯；大衛起誓說：「我若在日落以前吃飯或吃甚麼東西，願 神降罰我，重重地降罰我。」

words.note: A common V-O compound.
Lit. 'east-west', meaning 'thing'.
Refers to the Judeo-Christian God.
重重 (chóngchóng) is reduplication for emphasis.

verses.text: 眾人看見了，就都喜悅。王所作的一切，他們都很喜悅。

words.note: Indicates that the following verb describes something done or possessed.

verses.text: 那一天眾人和全以色列都知道，殺死尼珥的兒子押尼珥，並不是出於王的意思。

words.definition: definitely not, is not at all
to be from, to stem from

verses.text: 王對他的臣僕說：「你們不知道今天在以色列中，有一位將領和偉人倒斃了嗎？

words.note: A formal or literary term for dying, often tragically or in battle.

verses.text: 今天我雖然受膏為王，但我還是幼弱的。洗魯雅的兩個兒子太強了，非我所能應付。願耶和華照著惡人所行的惡，報應惡人。」

words.note: Refers to the religious ritual of anointing with oil.
Classical Chinese negation, meaning 'is not'.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase, e.g., '所能' (that which can be done).
The Hebrew name for God.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase, e.g., '所行' (that which is done).
Often refers to divine retribution or karma.
